exhibition.title: Golden Screen
exhibition.awarder: Mix media & painting 2024, Royal College of Art
exhibition.summary: This project draws inspiration from my childhood experiences with vasovagal syncopecharacterized by sudden vomiting and fainting. The disorder, surrealism, chaos, and despair brought about by this illness are mir-rored and explored within the artwork.

exhibition.title: The North Wind
exhibition.awarder: 2022 CAFA Undergraduate Graduation Exhibition, CAFA Art Museum
exhibition.summary: The theme and narrative vein is that of several women in the county, who are a granny who harbours divine skills, a cousin and an elderly female customer. The work uses Bourdieu's field theory and Žižek's four true forms of coping with injury as theoretical support to explore how they survive and flow, and how they go through their lives.

exhibition.title: Transformation Of Chemical Sites in The Context of Ecological Sustainability
exhibition.awarder: 2022 CAFA Undergraduate Group Graduation Exhibition, CAFA Art Museum
exhibition.summary: With the necessity of industrial transformation and the enhancement of people's cultural needs, we focused on the former site of the Beijing Coking Plant, and researched and thought about a series of problems that existed in the plant from multiple perspectives. Combined with the above results, we packaged and transformed the chemical site in the context of ‘ecological sustainability’, using digital ruin restoration, dynamic visual and graphic design methods, from the introduction of industrial history, eco-chemical science and multi-faceted publicity and so on.
